sections.title: Introduction
sections.content:

This article or section is out of date.

This page contains information and tips for installing and configuring Arch Linux on the Asus Zenbook UX32A.

sections.title: Installation
sections.content: The installation should work with no problems and Wi-Fi should work out of the box. The UX32A ships in two versions: either with 500 GB HDD + 24 GB SSD or with 128 GB HDD and 128 GB SSD. Since 24 GB is more then enough for a full Arch Linux installation, it is recommended to install at least the non-home partitions onto the SSD.

sections.title: Compatibility
sections.content: Most things work without problems. To control the keyboard backlight, you have to follow the instructions here: ASUS Zenbook Prime UX31A#Keyboard backlight.

sections.title: Function keys
sections.content:
The following function keys work:

- Standby (Fn+F1)
- Screen brightness (Fn+F5/F6)
- Turn Screen on/off (Fn+F7)

The other keys are recognised and yield the specific signal with the exception of the Presentation Mode (Fn+F8), which only yields 'p' and the Wi-Fi button, which is not recognised at all.
